# AWS EC2 Instances Comparison

Discover and compare AWS EC2 instance specifications and pricing on a single page, covering various operating systems, payment types, and regions. Refer to the 'Best Price Region' column to identify the region where a specific instance is most cost-effective, or compare prices across different saving options. Additionally, discover alternative instances using our built-in Best Alternative Instances recommender.

The data is frequently updated from the AWS API, but may not be accurate. This site is not affiliated with Amazon or AWS. The latest update occurred onSeptember 18, 2024 at 12:24 AM UTC

New   We have added **Spot Price History** for [Azure](/spot-history), [AWS](/aws/spot-history), and [GCP](/aws/spot-history). You can now view data for more than 3 months. Check it out and let us know what you think by leaving your thoughts [here](https://cloudprice.featurebase.app/) or just drop a [message](mailto:support@cloudprice.net).

# Azure VM Comparison

Discover and compare Azure Virtual Machines, [AWS EC2](/aws/ec2), and [GCP instance](/gcp/compute) specifications and pricing across multiple tiers, payment options, and geographical regions, all on one comprehensive page. Use the 'Best Price Region' feature to quickly find where a specific VM offers the greatest value. For insights on optimizing cost vs. performance, visit our [price/performance](/performance) analysis page.

The data is frequently updated from the Azure API, but may not be accurate. This site is not affiliated with Microsoft or Azure. The latest update occurred onSeptember 25, 2024 at 1:04 AM UTC

New   We have added **Spot Price History** for [Azure](/spot-history), [AWS](/aws/spot-history), and [GCP](/aws/spot-history). You can now view data for more than 3 months. Check it out and let us know what you think by leaving your thoughts [here](https://cloudprice.featurebase.app/) or just drop a [message](mailto:support@cloudprice.net).

# Azure VMs Price / Performance Comparison

Currently the most cost efficient virtual machine in Azure is **Standard\_B1ls** with 1 vCPUs and 0.5 GiB of memory. Below you can see the comparison chart of all VM types. The benchmark results were collected from official Azure documentation and are available [here](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/virtual-machines/linux/compute-benchmark-scores#about-coremark). The tests were done using [CoreMark](https://www.eembc.org/coremark/faq.php) utility on Linux machines with Ubuntu 18.04. Some VM types have a grey color, meaning that they are Burstable VMs. They should be treated separately because they cannot constantly perform on that level of performance. Please pay attention to the fact that there could be different results in different regions due to differences in regional pricing. The latest update occurred onSeptember 29, 2024 at 2:26 PM UTC

# Google Compute Engine Instances Comparison

Discover and compare Google Compute Engine instance specifications and pricing on a single page, covering various operating systems, payment types, and regions. Refer to the 'Best Price Region' column to identify the region where a specific instance is most cost-effective, or compare prices across different saving options. Additionally, discover alternative instances using our built-in Best Alternative Instances recommender.

The data is frequently updated from the GCP API, but may not be accurate. This site is not affiliated with Google or Google Cloud Platform. The latest update occurred onSeptember 27, 2024 at 12:02 AM UTC

New   We have added **Spot Price History** for [Azure](/spot-history), [AWS](/aws/spot-history), and [GCP](/aws/spot-history). You can now view data for more than 3 months. Check it out and let us know what you think by leaving your thoughts [here](https://cloudprice.featurebase.app/) or just drop a [message](mailto:support@cloudprice.net).

# GCP Instances Price / Performance Comparison

Currently the most cost efficient instance in GCP is **t2d-standard-4** with 4 vCPUs and 16 GiB of memory. Below you can see the comparison chart of all instance types in the **Iowa /us-central1** region. The benchmark results were collected from official GCP documentation and are available [here](https://cloud.google.com/compute/docs/coremark-scores-of-vm-instances). The tests were done using [CoreMark](https://www.eembc.org/coremark/faq.php) utility. Please pay attention to the fact that there could be different results in different regions due to differences in regional pricing. The latest update occurred onSeptember 27, 2024 at 12:02 AM UTC

# Average Price for Azure Regions

Currently the cheapest region in Azure is **Central India / centralindia** with average per hour price is $1.05 comparing to 2.4x more expensive **Brazil Southeast / brazilsoutheast**. Below you can find the chart with the average price in USD per hour among the most common VMs in the region. Some VM types were excluded such as G-series, L-series and NV/NC due to their absence in some regions. Choose region and VM size wisely. The chart below shows the average price across regions but in some places, VMs can be cheaper than in West US 2. You can find the cheapest region on the [main page](/) in the column - Best price region.

# Average Price for GCP Regions

Currently the cheapest region in GCP is **Ohio(Columbus) / us-east5** with average per hour price is $0.083 comparing to 4.0x more expensive **Saudi Arabia(Dammam) / me-central2**.Below, you can find a chart showing the average price in USD per hour for the most common instances in each region. The calculation is based on: n1-standard-2, n2-standard-2, n2d-standard-2, c3-standard-4, e2-standard-2, t2d-standard-2, and g2-standard-4 instances. Other instance types are excluded as they are not offered in all regions. The chart displays the average prices across various regions. However, certain instances may be less expensive in regions other than the cheapest one. To find the cheapest region, visit the [main page](/gcp/compute). The "Best Price Region" is indicated in the corresponding column.

The latest update occurred onSeptember 27, 2024 at 12:02 AM UTC

# Azure Exchange Rates

Azure uses internal exchange rates for different currencies, and it appears these are not updated frequently. Below is a table calculated automatically and daily using official foreign exchange rates alongside Azure's internal exchange rates. The accompanying chart illustrates the differences between these exchange rates.

The latest update occurred onSeptember 29, 2024 at 12:00 AM UTC

| TRY | Turkish Lira (TL) | 34.06 | -0.4% |

# Plans and pricing

CloudPrice already assists **thousands of users** each month in reducing costs and selecting the optimal VM size, regions, and rates, among other things. To cover hosting and cloud expenses, eliminate ads, and enable the development of new features, we are introducing the **Subscription Tier**. This offering comes with novel tools and features that further aid in optimizing your Azure/AWS/GCP deployments.

#### Free

# $0/month

- AWS, Azure and GCP
- Specs for each Instance
- Similar Instances
- Price/Performance comparison

#### Monthly

# $9.95/month

- View **ALL** best price regions
- Comparison for **Savings Options**
- Spot Price History **\> 3 months**
- Programmatic **API access**
- Compare more than 2 Instances
- VMs recommendations
- Price/Perf for **Savings Options**

\\* and all free tier features

Start free trial

#### Yearly

# ~~$120~~ $79.95/year

- View **ALL** best price regions
- Comparison for **Savings Options**
- Spot Price History **\> 3 months**
- Programmatic **API access**
- Compare more than 2 Instances
- VMs recommendations
- Price/Perf for **Savings Options**

\\* and all free tier features

Start free trial

If you are interested in accessing data **in bulk** daily, please [contact us](mailto:support@cloudprice.net?subject=bulk access).

People from these companies are using CloudPrice.net

![Microsoft](https://cloudprice.net/_next/image?url=%2F_next%2Fstatic%2Fmedia%2Fmicrosoft.1f74105c.png&w=384&q=75)![Intel](https://cloudprice.net/_next/image?url=%2F_next%2Fstatic%2Fmedia%2Fintel.e8c46c4a.png&w=128&q=75)![Accenture](https://cloudprice.net/_next/image?url=%2F_next%2Fstatic%2Fmedia%2Faccenture.9d7c9ed0.png&w=384&q=75)![Associated Press](https://cloudprice.net/_next/image?url=%2F_next%2Fstatic%2Fmedia%2Fap.31905ccd.png&w=64&q=75)![UBS](https://cloudprice.net/_next/image?url=%2F_next%2Fstatic%2Fmedia%2Fubs.57bcb5d2.png&w=256&q=75)![Walmart](https://cloudprice.net/_next/image?url=%2F_next%2Fstatic%2Fmedia%2Fwalmart.fa7aedf6.png&w=256&q=75)![LG](https://cloudprice.net/_next/image?url=%2F_next%2Fstatic%2Fmedia%2Flg.079ff0a9.png&w=256&q=75)

# Features available with subscription

#### View ALL Best Price Regions

In the free tier, you can see only the four best regions that offer the cheapest pricing for each instance. The paid tier will give you access to a chart comparing all regions for each instance size, sorted by price.

That will help you find the cheapest Instance closest to your region. For example difference between Norway West vs West Europe on Azure for same Standard\_D2\_v4 is **62%**. On average users optimize their deployments on \*17-20% only based on choosing correct regions.

\\* based on users' feedbacks

![hint](https://cloudprice.net/_next/static/media/bestregions.8b3a38bd.webp)

#### Spot Price History

With a subscription, you will be able to view and analyze Spot Price History data beyond 3 months. For Azure, the data is available starting from 2022 and varies by instance type. For AWS, data is available starting from early 2024.

![hint](https://cloudprice.net/_next/image?url=%2F_next%2Fstatic%2Fmedia%2Fspothistory.110cb29a.webp&w=3840&q=95)

#### Savings Options Comparison

In paid tier you will able to compare all available savings options for particular instance in selected region. For example on Azure you will able to compare across On-Demand, Reservations, Savings Plans, Spot. On GCP between sustainable discounts, 1-3y Commitments. On AWS you will be able to compare across all 26 different options.

Pricing for **Reservations** or **Savings Plans** for instances also varies across regions, and you should choose and make reservations in advance. Make sure to select the right region and VM size wisely to avoid unnecessary future changes and wasting money.

![hint](https://cloudprice.net/_next/image?url=%2F_next%2Fstatic%2Fmedia%2Fsavings.8553407c.png&w=3840&q=95)

#### Advanced Comparison Tool

Easily compare **up to 5 instances** at once. Analyze all instance specs line by line, or even the pricing in different regions for these VM types, on a unified comparison screen. Copy and paste the URL with the comparison and share it with your colleagues.

![hint](https://cloudprice.net/_next/image?url=%2F_next%2Fstatic%2Fmedia%2Fcomparisontool.7be90a33.webp&w=3840&q=95)

#### Programmatic API access

All data available on CloudPrice.net and even more is available through the REST API via our brand new [CloudPrice Developer Portal](https://developer.cloudprice.net) using an API key. Fetch data and use it in your apps and scripts.

Those who need access to the full dataset in bulk without API throttling can use our bulk export functionality. To gain access to bulk export, please [contact us](mailto:support@cloudprice.net?subject=bulk access)

![hint](https://cloudprice.net/_next/image?url=%2F_next%2Fstatic%2Fmedia%2Fapi-access.f18ca085.png&w=3840&q=95)

#### Price/Performance for Reserved 1y-3y

In the public view, you can see price/performance for virtual machine comparisons across all regions, but only for the pay-as-you-go model. Under subscription, you will get access to data for **Reserved 1-3y** or **Savings plans** payment models. The pricing for each VM is different across regions and payment models, therefore price/performance ratio are be different as well. This will help you find the most valuable VM in a particular region for your reservations.

For instance using 24 x Standard\_F2s\_v2 instead of 1 x Standartd\_F48s\_v2 is **more efficient on 9.5%** from price/performance standpoint view with same number of CPU and RAM.

![hint](https://cloudprice.net/_next/image?url=%2F_next%2Fstatic%2Fmedia%2Fperformance.aebf3ee0.webp&w=3840&q=95)

# Average Price for AWS Regions

Currently the cheapest region in AWS is **Asia Pacific (Malaysia) / ap-southeast-5** with average per hour price is $0.063comparing to 4.9x more expensive **South America (São Paulo) / sa-east-1**.Below, you can find a chart showing the average price in USD per hour for the most common instances in each region. The calculation is based on c5.large, c6.large, m5.large, r5.large, and t3.small instances. Other instance types are excluded as they are not offered in all regions. The chart displays the average prices across various regions. However, certain instances may be less expensive in regions other than the cheapest one. To find the cheapest region, visit the [main page](/aws/ec2). The "Best Price Region" is indicated in the corresponding column.

The latest update occurred onSeptember 18, 2024 at 12:24 AM UTC
